title: Google Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL Could Run On 5G, Beating Apple In Launching First 5G Phone
text:
After iPhone 11, the next phone everyone's anticipating this year is the Pixel 4 (and Pixel 4XL) by Google.

Oddly enough, leaks have given us a clear idea for what to expect from this year's Google flagship, and now, a new leak tells us that it could come with 5G connectivity, beating Apple in the 5G race.

Reuters

According to a report by Nikkei Asian Review, sources say that Google has begun test production of a smartphone running 5G which could be revealed sometime next week, alongside Google Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL 4G variants on October 15.

But the device is still under test production, which indicates that it might not go on sale alongside Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL. Sources also hint that the device could actually hit the shelves alongside its budget offerings in 2020 spring (with Pixel 4a and 4a XL, maybe).

However, this isn't a bad thing, considering that 5G is still in its early stages in the US and the chipset handling 5G connectivity still lacks optimisation to enable better battery life.

Google

Speaking of Google's Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL, the Mountain View giant has already teased the images of Pixel 4, giving us a clear idea for what we can expect from the smartphone. Moreover, leaks post that have given us even more information of this flagship.

The Pixel 4 is expected to feature a 5.8-inch display, while the 4XL is set to offer a 6.4-inch panel. Both are expected to have a Quad HD+ resolution. The top of the display is going to house a bunch of sensors (as teased by Google) that will enable gesture-based navigation by simply waving on top of the screen.

Ben Geskin

Under the hood, Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL is expected to get Qualcomm's Snapdragon 855 Plus, a slightly overclocked version of the regular Snapdragon 855, paired with 6GB of RAM as well as 128GB and 256GB storage variants.

Google teased a dual-camera setup on the Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL. While there is no exact information about the primary camera, the secondary camera is expected to get a 16-megapixel sensor with a telephoto lens for crispy zoom images. The device is also expected to get a single front camera for selfies this time.
description: After iPhone 11, the next phone everyone's anticipating this year is the Pixel 4 by Google. Oddly enough, leaks have given us a clear idea for what to expect from this year's Google flagship, and a new leak tells us that it could come with 5G connectivity, beating Apple to a pulp.
